item.title: Y add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Y add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "It seemed funny that the sunset she saw from her patio and the one I saw from the back steps was the same one. Maybe the two worlds we lived in werenâ€™t so different. We saw the same sunset." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Y add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "They grew up on the outside of society. They weren't looking for a fight. They were looking to belong." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Y add a quote by Isabel Wilkerson
item.description: "Our Negro problem, therefore, is not of the Negro's making. No group in our population is less responsible for its existence. But every group is responsible for its continuance.... Both races need to understand that their rights and duties are mutual and equal and their interests in the common good are idential.... There is no help or healing in apparaising past responsibilities or in present apportioning of praise or blame. The past is of value only as it aids in understanding the present; and an understanding of the facts of the problem--a magnanimous understanding by both races--is the first step toward its solution." -- Isabel Wilkerson

item.title: Y add a quote by Isabel Wilkerson
item.description: "It occurred to me that no matter where I lived, geography could not save me." -- Isabel Wilkerson
